title: ‘Australia’s first’ biomethane-to-gas project launched
lead: Wastewater from Sydney’s Malabar treatment plant will be used to generate biomethane

title: CfD: Government to back 12GW of renewable energy capacity in next auction
lead: It intends to double the capacity of renewable energy and expand the number of technologies supported when the fourth round opens in late 2021

title: Switching to EVs ‘could save Brits £57k on lifetime fuel costs’
lead: The average lifetime cost of charging an EV is £6,000, according to new research by the energy company EDF

title: Global carbon dioxide levels ‘remain at record highs despite Covid-19 lockdown’
lead: The last time carbon dioxide levels were that high was three to five million years ago, according to the World Meteorological Organisation

title: INEOS inks agreement with Hyundai for hydrogen production
lead: Both companies seek to develop a ‘hydrogen value chain’ in Europe

title: New partnership to help Egyptian farmers buy solar irrigation systems
lead: Using solar power for pumping water is estimated to help farmers save $875m annually in diesel fuel costs

title: Quick-response batteries and flexible gas plants ‘could boost renewable deployment at a lower cost’
lead: Wärtsilä claims installing 7GW of flexibility capacity to balance renewable generation could see the share of clean power reach 62%, higher than it says would be possible by deploying wind and solar alone

title: UK’s Air Quality Expert Group seeks evidence on fine particulate matter
lead: Responses from scientific experts will help inform government’s approach to reducing the pollutant

title: Household bills could rise by £21 as Ofgem considers increasing energy price cap
lead: The regulator is consulting on its proposals to recover debt-related costs that have resulted due to the coronavirus pandemic

title: Second farmer-led group set up in Scotland to tackle climate change
lead: The Arable Sector Climate Group will identify measures that support the arable and cropping sectors to contribute to Scotland’s climate targets
